content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is eating breakfast as Chandler comes out of his bedroom, ripping his coat in the process.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow! That ripped! That ripped real nice!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How many times do I have to tell you! Ya, turn and sliiiide! Y’know, turn and slide.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You don’t turn and slide, you throw it out! I’m tired of having to get a tetanus shot every time I get dressed!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, we’re not throwing it out! I built this thing with my own hands!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, how about we, how ‘bout we sell it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right. But, you’re gonna have to tell them. (He opens the cabinet to reveal the chick and the duck living inside with Christmas lights and a disco ball as decorations.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Do you mind if we stick you in another cabinet? (to Joey) They seem all right with it!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Ross are there. Monica is checking the messages.

content.speaker: Chip
content.text: Hey Monica, it’s Chip.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yesss!!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Who’s Chip?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Shhh!

content.speaker: Chip
content.text: Good runnin’ into you at the bank today, so ah, here’s my number, 555-9323. Give me a call. Later.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Chip, is Chip Matthews.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The guy who took Rachel to the prom? Why is he calling you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: ‘Cause I ran into him at the bank, he is still soo cute.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica, you’re so lucky! He’s like the most popular guy in school!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know!! (calls him) (on phone) Chip? Hi! It’s Monica. (listens) ‘Kay. (listens) ‘Kay. (listens) Okay. (listens) Okay, good-bye. (hangs up) Oh my God, we just had the best conversation!! (goes into her room as Rachel enters)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I was just leaving.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Good! ‘Cause I’ve got a product report to read, it’s like eight pages, I hope I don’t fall asleep.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Why? Did you write it?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! Look at that, Chip Matthews called. I wonder what he wants?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well ah, actually…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I bet he sensed that I was ready to have sex with another guy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, umm, why don’t you give him a call?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay. (picks up phone) Are you sure you wanna hear this?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I’m sure.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chip! Hi, it’s Rachel. (listens) Rachel Green. Yeah, umm, you left me a message. (listens) Yes you did, my roommate wrote it down. (listens) Monica Geller. (listens) Ohh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, that’s right! He called to ask out Monica! That-that’s gotta be embarrassing!

content.description: Central Perk, Phoebe is finishing up a song.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: …DUMB, DRUNKEN, BITCH!!! (applause) (happily) Thank you, thanks.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, here’s a question; where did you guys get the finest oak East of the Mississippi?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh-huh, first you tell us where you got the prettiest lace in all the land.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m reading your ad.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Looks good, uh?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Stunning entertainment center. Fine, (pause) fine Italian craftsmanship. (Joey is very proud of himself)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God, you guys are selling the entertainment center?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why? I love that thing.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You want it?

content.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
content.text: Oh no.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ahh, Gepeto, $5,000 dollars? Are you insane?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, the ad alone cost 300 bucks!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right look, I’m changing it to 50 bucks, or your best offer.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What kind of profit is that?! And you call yourself an accountant.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nooo.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh. What do you do?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I can’t believe you don’t know what I do for a living!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, I actually don’t know…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Good, so do I

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Something to do with numbers?
[Cut to someone entering Central Perk which lets a cat in. The cat then runs over to Phoebe’s guitar case and starts sniffing around.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! No! Shoo! Kitty! No! No-no-no! Shoo! Come on, you! (goes over and picks up the cat) Come on. Crazy. (looks into the cat’s eyes) Oh my God.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Nothing. Nothing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What? What’s wrong?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I just, I just have this really strong feeling that this cat is my Mother.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You mean the mom you met in Montauk. She was a cat?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, no-no, she was a human lady. This is the spirit of my Mom Lily, the one who killed herself.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Are you sure she’s in the cat, or have you been taking your grandma’s glycoma medicine again?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No Dr. Skeptismo! I’m sure. First of all, okay, there’s the feeling. (Chandler shrugs) Okay, and for another, how about the fact that she went into my guitar case which is lined with orange felt. (Rachel nods her head in unsure agreement) My Mother’s favourite fish is Orange Roughy… (Joey thinks he understands, but then nods that he has no clue.) Cats…like…fish! (Ross and Rachel are totally lost) (to the cat) Hi, Mommy. (Rachel covers her mouth, in an “Oh my God.” gesture) Oh, I haven’t seen this smile in 17 years!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude, Phoebe’s mom has got a huge peni…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Let it go!!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is working as Monica enters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Umm, when were you gonna tell me that you’re going out with Chip Matthews?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Now? Is it okay if I go out with Chip Matthews?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Nooo! It’s not okay! I can’t believe you would want to after what he did to me!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What, that little thing at the prom?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Monica! I couldn’t find him for two hours! He was having sex with Amy Welch!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on, that was back in high school! How could that still bother you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I mean why, of all people would you want to go out with Chip?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look, you and I went to different high schools…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, that doesn’t help me, because we went to the same high school.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You went to one where you were popular, and you got to ride off Chip’s motorcycle, and wear his letterman jacket. I went to one where I wore a band uniform they had to have specially made.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: They had to have that specially made?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It was a project for one of the Home Ec classes.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God, they told us that was for the mascot!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Back then, I thought that I would never, ever get the chance to go out with a Chip Matthews, and now he’s-he’s called me up and asked me out. And the fat girl inside of me really wants to go. I-I owe her this. I never let her eat.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, you go out with him. (goes over and hugs her)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, really?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah. Just, if it’s possible, could you leave him somewhere and go have sex with another guy?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’ll try.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the next morning, they are all there eating breakfast.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So you guys having any luck getting rid of the entertainment center?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, there were a couple of calls last night, but ah, I don’t think any of them are gonna work out.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, Joey has a very careful screening process. Apparently, not everyone is qualified to own wood and nails.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Stop it! Stop it! She keeps squirming, trying to get away! Just like when she was alive.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So Pheebs, how long is your mom gonna be with us?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I’m not sure. I mean, I guess until she y’know, gets used to the fact that there’s y’know, a new mom. Y’know, I think she’s worried that y’know, she’s gonna, she’s gonna be replaced. (to the cat, in a funny voice) Well, that’s not gonna happen is it? Noo. (gets up) Okay, I have to return a call in the other room.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why can’t you use the phone in here?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I’m returning a call from a certain mom at the B-E-A-C-H. I just spelled the wrong word. (goes into Monica’s room)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, guys, am I crazy, or does Phoebe’s mom remind anyone of a cat ?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ross, don’t start.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on, you-you can’t tell me you actually believe that-that there’s a woman inside that cat!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I believe it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No you don’t.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, I do.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No you do—y’know what, you’re not gonna suck me into this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh sure I am, because you always have to be right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I do not always have to be—okay, okay. (starts to leave)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Jurassic Park could happen.
(Ross wants to say something, but just smiles and leaves.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey and Chandler are showing a couple of guys (Tony and Peter) the entertainment center.

content.speaker: Tony
content.text: Wow! That’s ah, that’s pretty nice!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pretty nice?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You’ll have to pardon my roommate, he wanted to marry this.

content.speaker: Tony
content.text: We don’t have 50 bucks, but would you be willing to trade for it? We’ve got a canoe.
(Joey jumps up in excitement and without turning around Chandler holds out his hand stopping him, and ushering him back into his seat. Joey sits down, dejected.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, I, I really don’t think we need a canoe.

content.speaker: Tony
content.text: You gotta take the canoe!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, just, just take the entertainment center, and then when you get home, throw the canoe away!

content.speaker: Peter
content.text: We’re not throwing it away! I built that canoe! (starts to leave as Tony chases after him)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Good for you!!

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler, Joey, Monica, and Ross are there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You guys, you’re never gonna believe what I just found tacked up on a telephone pole! (She’s holding a flyer.) Look kinda familiar?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Apparently Phoebe’s mother also goes by the name Julio.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You guys, there’s a little girl in Soho looking for this cat. I mean, you know what that means?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah-eah! 200 dollar reward, split five ways!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Do we have to tell her?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yes, we have to tell her!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, but it’s made her so happy.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Little girl misses her cat. (hold up the other hand) Crazy lady thinks her mother is in a cat. (gets up) Okay, y’know what, I have to go have dinner with my son, can I trust that when you see Phoebe, you will tell her.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I hate when Ross is right!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: He is right, isn’t he?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know what, I think this might be one of the times he’s wrong.

content.speaker: All
content.text: You think?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh-no, he’s right.

content.description: Central Perk, the same scene is continued from before the break. With Joey, Monica, Rachel, and Chandler sitting on the couch.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi. (sits down in the chair)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, Pheebs, about your mom…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How’s that going?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So great. Oh, we took a nap today and my Mom fell asleep on my tummy and purred.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s so sweet. (pause) I’m gonna get some coffee. (gets up and leaves)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Huh? What’d ya say Joe? I’ll be right there. (gets up and joins Joey)
content.parenthetical: sliding into Joey’s place on the couch to try and talk to Phoebe

content.text: (Rachel and Chandler slide into position.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebs…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I just feel so, uhh…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m coming already!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Jeez!
(They both get up and leave Phoebe alone.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel is reading at the kitchen table as there is a knock on the door.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! Not yet! (gets to her room and closes the door, as Rachel gets up to answer the door.)
content.parenthetical: running from the bathroom to her room, wearing only a towel

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hello, Chip.

content.speaker: Chip
content.text: Hey, Rach! How ya doin’?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m great! I’m great. I’ve got a great job at Bloomingdale’s , have wonderful friends, and eventhough I’m not seeing anyone right now, I’ve never felt better about myself.

content.speaker: Chip
content.text: So ah, Monica ready yet?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: She’ll be out in a second. So, Chip, how’s umm, Amy Welch?

content.speaker: Chip
content.text: Amy Welch? Wow! I haven’t seen her since… So, Monica about ready?

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is showing off the entertainment center.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: This is the unit for you my friend. Sturdy construction, tons of storage compartments, some big enough to fit a grown man.

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah! I got in there myself once. My roommate bet me five bucks that I couldn’t, and then he stuck a board through the handles that locked me in. Yeah. It was funny ‘til I started feeling like I was in a coffin.

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: No, you, you can’t fit in that thing. That’s not deep enough.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh yeah? (opens up the center and takes out the stereo) If I can’t, I’ll knock five bucks off the price off the unit.

content.speaker: Guy
content.text: All right, you have yourself a deal. (shakes his hand)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. (he gets in the unit and closes the door) See?! I told ya!
(The guys takes a hockey stick and slips it through the handles then proceeds to take the stereo and Chandler’s computer and walk out.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Sometimes I get in here just to get away from it! Hey, a nickel!!

content.description: A street, Chip is walking Monica to his motorcycle.

content.speaker: Chip
content.text: Here, we are.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! You still have the Chipper!

content.speaker: Chip
content.text: The what?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s what we used to call your ah, your motorcycle in high school. Y’know how a motorcycle is a Chopper, and you’re Chip. Nevermind.

content.speaker: Chip
content.text: No, I think it’s cute. (kisses her)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow! A lipper from Chipper.

content.speaker: Chip
content.text: So you still in touch with anyone from high school?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Umm. Well, there’s Rachel, and umm, I think that’s it. How bout you?

content.speaker: Chip
content.text: Oh yeah, I still hang with Simmons and Zana, y’know. I see Spindler a lot. Devane, Kelly, and I run into Goldie from time to time. Steve Brown, Zuchoff, McGwire, J.T., Breadsly.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Is that all?

content.speaker: Chip
content.text: Ehh, y’know after high school, you just kinda lose touch. Oh yeah! I ran into Richard Dorfman.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh, how is he?

content.speaker: Chip
content.text: Not so good, Simmons and I gave him a wedgie.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Isn’t he an architect now?

content.speaker: Chip
content.text: Yeah, they still wear underwear.

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Chandler is coming home. As we walks through the door, and without looking up, he goes to throw his keys on the foosball table, only, it’s gone and the keys it the floor. He then looks up at an empty apartment; everything is gone except for the entertainment center and that ceramic dog. Even the food in the fridge!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OH MY GOD!!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: WHAT?!!
content.parenthetical: still trapped in the entertainment center

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you all right?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What happened?!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Awww, man! He promised he wouldn’t take the chairs!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What the hell happened?!! How were you locked in?!! And where the hell is all of our stuff?!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, this guy came by to look at the unit and-and he said he didn’t think big enough to fit a grown man!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So—You got in voluntarily ?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I was tryin’ to make a sale!! Oh, man, if I ever run into that guy again, do you know what I’m gonna do?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: BEND OVER?!!!

content.description: Dot’s Spot, Chip and Monica are on there date, eating dinner. Chip is telling a story.

content.speaker: Chip
content.text: …and then Zana, just let one rip!! (laughs histerically)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look, not that I enjoy talking about people who I went to high school with, ‘cause I do, but umm, maybe we could talk about something else? Like you, I don’t even know where you work?

content.speaker: Chip
content.text: You know where I work!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I do?

content.speaker: Chip
content.text: The movie theatre, you used to come in all the time.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You still work at the multiplex?

content.speaker: Chip
content.text: Oh, like I’d give up that job! Free popcorn and candy, anytime I want. I can get you free posters for your room.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Thanks, I’m set. Do you still live with your parents?

content.speaker: Chip
content.text: Oh yeah, but I can stay out as late as I want.
(Monica takes a big swig of her martini.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Rachel, Phoebe, and Julio are consoling Joey and Chandler.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! They really got you guys. Your T.V. The chairs.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah, your microwave. The stereo.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Aww, man, he took the five of spades!! Oh, no-no-no, here it is!
content.parenthetical: looking through a deck of cards

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! What happened?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, umm, Joey was born, and then 28 years later, I was robbed!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So, how was your date?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, y’know how I always wanted to go out with Chip Matthews in high school?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um-hmm.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, tonight, I actually went out with Chip Matthews in high school.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh honey, I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, it’s okay, not only did I get to go out with Chip Matthews, I got to dump Chip Matthews.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh! That’s so great!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey! So ah, what did the insurance company say?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, they said uh, “You don’t have insurance here, so stop calling us.”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You didn’t tell her?! (They all kinda shy away.) Okay, fine! Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah? (sees Ross) Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi! Listen uhh, this cat belongs to a little girl. There are flyers all over the place.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m sorry, sweetie. (shows her the flyer)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, we can take her back with you if you want.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh. Um-hmm. But y’know, she choose to find me. I mean, I have to respect her decision. Right?

content.speaker: Chandler, Monica, Joey, and Rachel
content.text: That’s a good call. Right.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! No! Look—Hey, enough is enough! Look, I am sorry that you feel guilty or whatever about spending time with your new mom, but this is not your old mom. This is a cat! Okay, Julio the cat! Not mom! Cat!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ross, how many parents have you lost?
content.parenthetical: she turns around and puts the cat on the entertainment center

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: None.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, then you don’t know what it feels like when one of them comes back. Do you? I believe this is my Mother. Even if I’m wrong, who cares? Just be a friend. Okay? Be supportive.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m sorry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know what to say.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You could… say you’re sorry to her mom.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I think she would like that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come here, here, come here, come here, (pause) Mrs. Buffay. Sorry, about what I said, umm, it was, it was insensitive of me to say that you were just a cat. When clearly you are also the reincarnated spirit, of my friend’s mother.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thank you. We both forgive you.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So honey, what are you gonna do about the little girl?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, okay, listen, umm, Mom, I hope you know you still mean a lot to me. And you’re welcome to come back anytime.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Pheebs, if she could come back as a couch, we’d really appreciate it. (Joey nods in agreement)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come on, Mom, I’ll take you home.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’ll go with you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Me too. (they all leave)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh! Y’know, I’ve got an extra futon.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Dude, you don’t have to brag! We got nothing here!!

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey and Chandler have trading the entertainment center for the canoe. Joey is sitting in the bow, staring off into space as to envision his future full of possibilities. Chandler is sitting at the stern, staring into space and is looking at an uncertain future.
